summary: Brijesh enjoys programming and problem-solving and sees hacking on software as a way of life rather than just a job. His brain is full of useless facts, such as maps, and he thinks the techie shall inherit the planet.

projects.name: Goutube
projects.description: Streaming utility to build largely-scalable, highly available, fast, secure distributed streaming APIs
projects.summary: Golang, gRPC, Serf, Ring, and Kubernetes
highlights: cluster membership using Hashicorp serf
used crypto/tls for authentication and authorization
developed (replica-aware) load balancers from scratch
developed file management module to store points (files) and point-cron to collect and close files should no longer be opened
used Redis to store peer offsets to help synchronize two servers easily
built (replica-aware) load balancer from scratch
developed picker and resolver for gRPC
used Brijeshlakkad/ring for peer-to-peer architecture
* protocol to transfer responsibility upon joining a new node
replication using `net` at the transport layer
developed Goutube client that consumes data from multiple servers as per its bandwidth

projects.name: Ring
projects.description: Go utility for Peer to Peer Architecture
projects.summary: Golang, gRPC, Serf, Ring, and Kubernetes
highlights: used Hashicorp serf for cluster membership
developed a consistent hashing algorithm
observer-pattern to let the node know about transferring its (some part of) responsibility to the new node
developed Paxos consensus algorithm with net transport and connection pool
set up continuous integration using GitHub actions
* used crypto/tls for transport layer security
